titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Silas Gilbert Patterson Papers 1692-1913 MS 024 MS 024 MS 024
titlestmt.author: Processed by Ryan Bachman

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-02-02 07:49:17 -0800.

did.abstract: Silas Gilbert Patterson was born in Cornwall in 1838. A land surveyor by trade, Patterson resided in Cornwall Bridge and operated the Bonney Farm .

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The collection was given to the Cornwall Historical Society in 1986 by the Goshen Historical Society, after they received them from a Patterson descendant living in Torrington, Connecticut.

archdesc.userestrict:

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Silas Gilbert Patterson Papers; MS 024; box number; folder number; Cornwall Historical Society

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Silas Gilbert Patterson was born in Cornwall in 1838. A land surveyor by trade, Patterson resided in Cornwall Bridge and operated the Bonney Farm . The papers in the S. G. Patterson Collection mainly relate to his interest in genealogy. Patterson collected information on families that he was descended from personally, as well as other local Cornwall families that piqued his interest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection is contained in two archival boxes. The first series consists of letters written to and from S. G. Patterson. Most of these letters concern genealogical questions, although several personal letters deal with issues such as business at the Bonney Farm, family news, and Patterson’s efforts to help a friend reconnect with relatives in Ireland.

The second series consists mainly of genealogical and historical documents collected by S. G. Patterson. Patterson had a particular interest in the Hart family and collected dozens of deeds relating to them. The Hart deeds detail the family’s movement from Farmington, Connecticut westward to newly laid-out townships like Cornwall and Canaan, Connecticut as well as New Marlborough and Tyringham, Massachusetts. The rest of the documents are an assortment of personal items and genealogical and historical research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged chronologically within each series.
The files are grouped into 5 series:

did.unittitle: Correspondence with Mrs. H. W. Carter
Correspondence with Cynthia R. H. Monroe
Correspondence with Mrs. G. L. Moore
Correspondence with Mrs. J. S. Comstock
Correspondence with Bonney and Patterson family members regarding business at the Bonney Farm
Correspondence regarding the heirs of Seth, Amy, and Marietta Pierce
Correspondence regarding Meaghur family members in Ireland
Letter and attached newspaper article by S. G. Patterson from A. P. Smith
Appointment of Seth Pierce as executor of John Hart’s estate
Nathan Hart deed from Joel Millard
Rufus Hart deeds with Seth Pierce
Silas Hart deeds with Seth and Amy Pierce
Thomas Hart deed to Seth Pierce
Titus Hart deed from Phineas Hart
Bank records with The Iron Bank of Fall’s Village and First National Bank of New Milford
Fire insurance policy on the Bonney Farm
Composition book listing meteorological data, business dealings with the Cornwall Bridge Iron Co., and personal genealogical information
Ebenezer Birdseye deed to Seth Pierce
List of polls and ratable estate, Cornwall
Genealogical notes on the Gilbert family
“Genealogical” section of the Boston Evening Transcript
Samuel A. Judson petition to Litchfield Superior Court
Patrick McGowan indenture to Riley Rexford
Matthew Millard deed to Joseph Pangborn
Memoranda from Elnathan Patterson’s account book
Notes on descendants of Sherman and Huldah Patterson
Revolutionary War record of Sherman Patterson
Russell Pratt and Stephen Foster petition to Litchfield Superior Court
Thomas Robbins deed to Elijah Griswould
“Sackett Family in America,” by C. H. Weygant
Survey of land on Canaan Mountain
Letter from George Wheaton to James Wadsworth
George Wheaton deed to Daniel B. Phillips
Charles Whittesey letter from his son
Complaint of assault involving Henry Willis
Folder with notes on collection’s provenance from Goshen Historical Society, 1986
